outputs.output_descr:
This is to give the continuation of Electoral Support Project to run up to 2009 to address the following challenges that remain impediment to the delivery of NEC's constitutional mandate in conducting peaceful, free and fair National Elections in subsequent years. 
1.
2.	Training of Trainers Programme in Civic Education
	Development of  Sustainable Staff 

3.	Development of Effective Management Information System (MIS)

4.	Promote Public Sensitisation and Civic and Voter Education
5.	Support greater engagement to Civil Society Groups

6.	Promote Sustainable Democracy through the Conduct of Bye Elections
7.	Develop NEC's Infrastructural Capacity

8.	Electoral Law Reform
9.	Electoral Training Initiative

Through a robust 6 months technical assistnace programme targeting the above referred areas, it is expected to support NEC and PPRC on a daily basis by training of the technical/operational staff, revision and updating internal procedures and programmes, improving legal framework to bridge identified shortcomings in the existing laws and constitutional provisions, developing strategic long term plans anchored on the sustainability of electoral administration and instituional development. the expexted results will be the improvement of the existing baselines in the above referred domains and assembly of critical inputs to design, plan and implement the 2010-2013 electoral cycle programme in a way that will improve the organisation of 2012 elections and increase ownership and autonomy of both NEC and PPRC.

project_title: SUPPORT TO ELECTORAL MANAGEMENT BODIES - PHASE II
